resources.string: Android Call Logs Database not found
Press Back once more to exit
Enter directory path of image file relative to /sdcard/ (type default for default image)
Image cannot be decoded to Bitmap or no sdcard is detected.
Are you sure you want to delete
Are you sure you want to delete all contacts?

Speed Dialling
 
 To Add A Speed Dial Number: 
 1. Go to Contact List, and search for the target number.
 2. Press on the contact until a list of options appear. Choose Add to Speed Dial List option. The target contact will now appear on the Speed Dial list.
 3. To remove a Speed Dial number, simply press on the contact until a list of options appear, then choose Remove from Speed Dial List.
 4. To remove all Speed Dial contacts, just press on the remove all option on the bottom of the tab.

Contacts List
 
 Instructions: 
 1. To search for a contact, hit menu, and select search. Contact names that matches the typed characters will be shown below. 
 2. To delete all contacts, hit menu and select delete all. 
 3. To add a contact, hit menu, and select add contact. In the edit profile screen, hit menu again and select save to save the changes. 
 4. To view a contact, select a contact from the list. 5. To edit a contact, press a contact from the list, and a screen displays the information of the contact. Press Edit and edit the values, or long press a contact from the list, and choose the Edit Contact option. In the edit profile screen, hit menu again and select save to save the changes. 
 6. To change a contact's picture, simply edit the contact information. Hit the picture box. A new dialog box appears, revealing the storage. Search for the preferred picture. After choosing, press Save. 
 7. To call a contact, long press a user and select call, select the appropriate number if more than one number is stored. 
 8. To delete a contact, long press a contact from the list, and hit the delete option.

Call History
 
 Instructions: 
 1. To call the number in a call log entry, simply select the call log. 
 2. To add a new contact using that number, long press a call log entry and select add number to contacts. 
 3. To edit a number for dialing, long press a call log entry and select edit number before call. 
 4. To remove a call log entry, long press a call log entry and select remove from log. 
 5. To remove all call log entries, hit menu and select clear history.

Dialer
 
 Instructions: 
 For Landline Calls, either:
 1. Press the speakerbutton or raise the handset then dial the number.
 Or...
 2. Press the dialbox, enter the number, then press Done.
 Dialer must be using Line 1 for you to call a landline number.
 
 for VOIP Calls, either:
 1. Hit the text box to launch keyboard to type an alpha-numeric SIP address then press Done to call. 
 Or...
 2. Press the speaker button first then, use the dial pad to conveniently input the SIP number manually. 
 User must have a SIP account from a SIP provider. See Help Settings. 
 Another way of calling is selecting through the Contacts List. There is an option to call that number. Never forget what line should be used before calling.

Settings
 
 Press the Menu button then press VOIP settings first. A screen will appear containing all the neccessary information. 
 Legend: 
 1. Username = subscription username to SIP service provider 
 2. Password = subscription password to SIP service provider 
 3. Server = the domain name/IP address to register to the SIP provider 
 4. Port = the port number to be used for SIP calls, 5060 by default 
 5. Protocol = the protocol used for SIP calls, UDP by default 
 6. Connection type = the kind of connection to be used for SIP call 
 7. Use STUN = enable STUN 
 8. STUN server = the domain name/IP address of the STUN server 
 9. STUN server = the port number of the STUN server 
 10. Call type = the kind of gateway to be used, PSTN is only supported in selected US-based SIP providers 
 11. Exclude = the exclude pattern, blank by default 
 12. Auto-answer = the auto answer feature 
 13. Auto-answer on demand = the auto answer feature using a toggle switch on the status bar 
 14. Auto-answer on demand = the auto answer feature when wired headset is connected 
 15. Missed Call = enable the missed call notification 
 16. Voicemail = enable the voicemail notification 
 17. Ringtone = ringtone of the application when receiving a SIP call 
 
 Instructions: 
 1. To register, press register button. All necessary information must be entered first.
 2. To save settings, hit menu then select save settings. 
 3. To revert to recent saved settings, hit menu and select revert. 
 4. Pressing home will run the application on background, allowing the user to receive SIP calls even while running other programs.
Use onscreen dialpad when tablet is docked.
The tablet is not docked. VoIP calls only.
